intro: Cyclanthera oligoechinata, commonly known as the spiny cucumber, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, gourds, and melons. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and leaves, as well as its small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a elongated, ribbed berry that ripens to a yellowish-green color. Cyclanthera oligoechinata is often grown for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
